component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGL
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Component that creates a new maplibre-gl-js instance: {{#maplibre-gl initOptions=initOptions mapLoaded=(action 'mapLoaded') as |map|}} {{/maplibre-gl}}

attributes.name: MaplibreGL
attributes.description:
Component that creates a new maplibre-gl-js instance:

{{#maplibre-gl initOptions=initOptions mapLoaded=(action 'mapLoaded') as |map|}}

{{/maplibre-gl}}

arguments.name: initOptions
arguments.description: An options hash to pass on to the maplibre-gl-js instance. This is only used during map construction, and updates will have no effect.

arguments.name: mapLoaded
arguments.description: An action function to call when the map has finished loading. Note that the component does not yield until the map has loaded, so this is the only way to listen for the maplibre load event.

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGLCallComponent
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: A component used to call a specific Maplibre GL method.

attributes.name: MaplibreGLCallComponent
attributes.description: A component used to call a specific Maplibre GL method.

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGlImageComponent
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Adds an image for use in the map, see here. Properties name The unique name for the image. The name will be referenced in a source layer as the icon-image. Reference layers-symbol for more details. Property can also be used as the first positional parameter.   image The path to your image, typically /assets/<some_image>. Property can also be used as the second positional parameter.   width The width of the image in pixels.   height The height of the image in pixels.    Example {{#maplibre-gl as |map|}} {{map.image 'cat' '/assets/cat.png' width=48 height=48}} {{!-- `name` and `icon-image` used as positional params above --}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='symbol' layout=(hash icon-image='cat' icon-size=0.25))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] } });

attributes.name: MaplibreGlImageComponent
attributes.description:
Adds an image for use in the map, see here.

Properties

  • name
    • The unique name for the image. The name will be referenced in a source layer as the icon-image. Reference layers-symbol for more details. Property can also be used as the first positional parameter.
  • image
    • The path to your image, typically /assets/<some_image>. Property can also be used as the second positional parameter.
  • width
    • The width of the image in pixels.
  • height
    • The height of the image in pixels.

Example

{{#maplibre-gl as |map|}}
  {{map.image 'cat' '/assets/cat.png' width=48 height=48}}
  {{!-- `name` and `icon-image` used as positional params above --}}

  {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}}
    {{source.layer layer=(hash
        type='symbol'
        layout=(hash
          icon-image='cat'
          icon-size=0.25))}}
  {{/map.source}}
{{/maplibre-gl}}
import Controller from '@ember/controller';

export default Controller.extend({
  marker: {
    type: 'FeatureCollection',
    features: [
      {
        type: 'Feature',
        geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] }
      }
    ]
  }
});

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGLSource
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Adds a data source to the map. The API matches the maplibre source docs. Example: {{#maplibre-gl as |map|}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=(hash type='FeatureCollection' features=(array (hash type='Feature' geometry=(hash type='Point' coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642) ) ) ) )) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}}

attributes.name: MaplibreGLSource
attributes.description:
Adds a data source to the map. The API matches the maplibre source docs.

Example:

{{#maplibre-gl as |map|}}
  {{#map.source options=(hash
    type='geojson'
    data=(hash
      type='FeatureCollection'
      features=(array
        (hash
          type='Feature'
          geometry=(hash
            type='Point'
            coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642)
          )
        )
      )
    )) as |source|}}
    {{source.layer layer=(hash
        type='circle'
        paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}}
  {{/map.source}}
{{/maplibre-gl}}

arguments.name: layer
arguments.description: A hash to pass on to the maplibre layer.

arguments.name: before
arguments.description: The ID of an existing layer to insert the new layer before. If this argument is omitted, the layer will be appended to the end of the layers array.

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGlMarker
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: A utility that brokers HTTP requests...

attributes.name: MaplibreGlMarker
attributes.description: A utility that brokers HTTP requests...

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGLOn
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Adds an action to listen for maplibre events. Positional Parameters eventSource The first positional parameter. The event type to listen for.   action The second positional parameter. The action provided by the consumer to call when the event is triggered.    Example {{#maplibre-gl as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{/maplibre-gl}} import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } });

attributes.name: MaplibreGLOn
attributes.description:
Adds an action to listen for maplibre events.

Positional Parameters

  • eventSource
    • The first positional parameter. The event type to listen for.
  • action
    • The second positional parameter. The action provided by the consumer to call when the event is triggered.

Example

{{#maplibre-gl as |map|}}
  {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}}
{{/maplibre-gl}}
import Controller from '@ember/controller';

export default Controller.extend({
  actions: {
    mapClicked({ target: map, point }) {
      console.log(map, point);
    }
  }
});

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGLPopup
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Adds a popup to the map. Properties lngLat The longitude and latitude to pin the popup at.    Example {{#maplibre-gl as |map|}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=(hash type='FeatureCollection' features=(array (hash type='Feature' geometry=(hash type='Point' coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642) ) ) ) )) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{#map.popup lngLat=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642)}} Dallas, TX {{/map.popup}} {{/maplibre-gl}}

attributes.name: MaplibreGLPopup
attributes.description:
Adds a popup to the map.

Properties

  • lngLat
    • The longitude and latitude to pin the popup at.

Example

{{#maplibre-gl as |map|}}
  {{#map.source options=(hash
    type='geojson'
    data=(hash
      type='FeatureCollection'
      features=(array
        (hash
          type='Feature'
          geometry=(hash
            type='Point'
            coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642)
          )
        )
      )
    )) as |source|}}
    {{source.layer layer=(hash
        type='circle'
        paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}}
  {{/map.source}}

  {{#map.popup lngLat=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642)}}
    Dallas, TX
  {{/map.popup}}
{{/maplibre-gl}}

component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.title: MaplibreGLSource
component:ember-maplibre-gl/components/m.text: Adds a data source to the map. The API matches the maplibre source docs. Example: {{#maplibre-gl as |map|}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=(hash type='FeatureCollection' features=(array (hash type='Feature' geometry=(hash type='Point' coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642) ) ) ) ))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}}

attributes.name: MaplibreGLSource
attributes.description:
Adds a data source to the map. The API matches the maplibre source docs.

Example:

{{#maplibre-gl as |map|}}
  {{#map.source options=(hash
    type='geojson'
    data=(hash
      type='FeatureCollection'
      features=(array
        (hash
          type='Feature'
          geometry=(hash
            type='Point'
            coordinates=(array -96.7969879 32.7766642)
          )
        )
      )
    ))}}
  {{/map.source}}
{{/maplibre-gl}}

fields.name: options
fields.description: The ID of the source to add. Must not conflict with existing sources. {@link https://maplibre.org/maplibre-gl-js-docs/api/#map#addsource Maplibre}

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
An options hash to set as the source.

  • options.type

    • A string detailing the map source type. Typically geojson.

  • options.data

    • A data hash for the map, following the source.data API detailed by maplibre docs.

template:docs/actions.title: Capturing Events
template:docs/actions.text: Capturing Events Note: The example below uses ember-composable-helpers. Add the following map options to config/environment.js to style the map, set a default zoom level, and to provide a default centerpoint: 'maplibre-gl': { map: { style: 'https://demotiles.maplibre.org/style.json', zoom: 13, center: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } }, import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] }, actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } }); {{#maplibre-gl class='map-container' initOptions=(hash pitch=30) as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} The above example does the following: Creates an instance of a map Attaches a mapClicked action when anywhere on the map is clicked Generates a geojson map source (marker) Draws a blue circle on the map at the coordinates provided by marker

template:docs/container.title: The Container
template:docs/container.text: The Container Note: The example below uses ember-composable-helpers. Add the following map options to config/environment.js to style the map, set a default zoom level, and to provide a default centerpoint: 'maplibre-gl': { map: { style: 'https://demotiles.maplibre.org/style.json', zoom: 13, center: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } }, import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] }, actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } }); {{#maplibre-gl class='map-container' initOptions=(hash pitch=30) as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} The above example does the following: Creates an instance of a map Attaches a mapClicked action when anywhere on the map is clicked Generates a geojson map source (marker) Draws a blue circle on the map at the coordinates provided by marker

template:docs/index.title: Introduction
template:docs/index.text: Introduction Ember integration with maplibre-gl-js. Installation ember install ember-maplibre-gl Then, add your MapLibre configuration to config/environment.js: module.exports = function(environment) { let ENV = { 'maplibre-gl': {}, } Static Build By default, ember-maplibre-gl will load the maplibre-gl library dynamically via ember-auto-import's dynamic import support. If you would prefer for maplibre-gl-js to not be loaded dynamically, include an import 'maplibre-gl'; somewhere in your app and ember-auto-import will include it in your vendor bundle.

template:docs/installation.title: Installation
template:docs/installation.text: Installation Note: The example below uses ember-composable-helpers. Add the following map options to config/environment.js to style the map, set a default zoom level, and to provide a default centerpoint: 'maplibre-gl': { map: { style: 'https://demotiles.maplibre.org/style.json', zoom: 13, center: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } }, import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] }, actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } }); {{#maplibre-gl class='map-container' initOptions=(hash pitch=30) as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} The above example does the following: Creates an instance of a map Attaches a mapClicked action when anywhere on the map is clicked Generates a geojson map source (marker) Draws a blue circle on the map at the coordinates provided by marker

template:docs/templates.title: Templates
template:docs/templates.text: Templates Note: The example below uses ember-composable-helpers. Add the following map options to config/environment.js to style the map, set a default zoom level, and to provide a default centerpoint: 'maplibre-gl': { map: { style: 'https://demotiles.maplibre.org/style.json', zoom: 13, center: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } }, import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] }, actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } }); {{#maplibre-gl class='map-container' initOptions=(hash pitch=30) as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} The above example does the following: Creates an instance of a map Attaches a mapClicked action when anywhere on the map is clicked Generates a geojson map source (marker) Draws a blue circle on the map at the coordinates provided by marker

template:docs/usage.title: Usage
template:docs/usage.text: Usage Note: The example below uses ember-composable-helpers. Add the following map options to config/environment.js to style the map, set a default zoom level, and to provide a default centerpoint: 'maplibre-gl': { map: { style: 'https://demotiles.maplibre.org/style.json', zoom: 13, center: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } }, import Controller from '@ember/controller'; export default Controller.extend({ marker: { type: 'FeatureCollection', features: [ { type: 'Feature', geometry: { type: 'Point', coordinates: [ -96.7969879, 32.7766642 ] } } ] }, actions: { mapClicked({ target: map, point }) { console.log(map, point); } } }); {{#maplibre-gl class='map-container' initOptions=(hash pitch=30) as |map|}} {{map.on 'click' (action 'mapClicked')}} {{#map.source options=(hash type='geojson' data=marker) as |source|}} {{source.layer layer=(hash type='circle' paint=(hash circle-color='#007cbf' circle-radius=10))}} {{/map.source}} {{/maplibre-gl}} The above example does the following: Creates an instance of a map Attaches a mapClicked action when anywhere on the map is clicked Generates a geojson map source (marker) Draws a blue circle on the map at the coordinates provided by marker
